com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.core

Interface IFactorFunction

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IParametricFactorFunction
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Abs, ACos, AdditiveNoise, And, ASin, ATan, Bernoulli, Beta, Binomial, Categorical, CategoricalEnergyParameters, CategoricalUnnormalizedParameters, ComplexAbs, ComplexConjugate, ComplexDivide, ComplexExp, ComplexNegate, ComplexProduct, ComplexSubtract, ComplexSum, ComplexToRealAndImaginary, ConstantPower, ConstantProduct, Cos, Cosh, CustomFactorFunctionWrapper, DeterministicRealUnaryFactorFunction, Dirichlet, DiscreteTransition, DiscreteTransitionEnergyParameters, DiscreteTransitionUnnormalizedParameters, Divide, EqualDelta, Equality, Equals, ExchangeableDirichlet, Exp, FactorFunction, FactorFunctionWithConstants, FiniteFieldAdd, FiniteFieldMult, FiniteFieldProjection, Gamma, GreaterThan, GreaterThanOrEqual, InverseGamma, JointFactorFunction, LessThan, LessThanOrEqual, LinearEquation, Log, LogNormal, MatrixProduct, MatrixRealJointVectorProduct, MatrixVectorProduct, MixedNormal, Multinomial, MultinomialEnergyParameters, MultinomialUnnormalizedParameters, Multiplexer, MultivariateNormal, Negate, NegativeExpGamma, Normal, Not, NotEquals, Or, Poisson, Power, PriorFactor, Product, Rayleigh, RealAndImaginaryToComplex, RealJointNegate, RealJointProjection, RealJointSubtract, RealJointSum, RealJointToRealVector, RealVectorToRealJoint, Sin, Sinh, Sqrt, Square, Subtract, Sum, SumOfInputs, TableFactorFunction, Tan, Tanh, Uniform, VectorInnerProduct, VonMises, Xor, XorDelta

    public interface IFactorFunction
    Abstract interface for factor functions in Dimple.
    Since:
    0.07

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double eval(Value[] values)
      Evaluates the possibly unnormalized probability density of the arguments.
      void evalDeterministic(Value[] arguments)
      For deterministic-directed factor functions, set the value of the output variables given the input variables.
      double evalEnergy(Value[] values)
      Evaluates the possibly unnormalized negative log probability density of the arguments.
      java.lang.String getName() 
      boolean isDeterministicDirected() 
      boolean isDirected() 
      boolean isParametric()
      Indicates whether function implements IParametricFactorFunction interface.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()

      • isDeterministicDirected

        boolean isDeterministicDirected()
        Returns:
        true if function is deterministic ( i.e. eval(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[]) always returns either 0 or 1 for all arguments and evalEnergy(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[]) returns either zero or infinity) and directed.
        Since:
        0.07

      • isDirected

        boolean isDirected()
        Returns:
        true if function is inherently directed such that some of its arguments can be considered to be "outputs" of its other arguments.

      • isParametric

        boolean isParametric()
        Indicates whether function implements IParametricFactorFunction interface.
        Since:
        0.07

      • eval

        double eval(Value[] values)
        Evaluates the possibly unnormalized probability density of the arguments.

        This must be equivalent to exp(-evalEnergy(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[])(values)).

        Since:
        0.07

      • evalEnergy

        double evalEnergy(Value[] values)
        Evaluates the possibly unnormalized negative log probability density of the arguments.

        This must be equivalent to -log(eval(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[])(values)).

        Since:
        0.07

      • evalDeterministic

        void evalDeterministic(Value[] arguments)
        For deterministic-directed factor functions, set the value of the output variables given the input variables.
        Since:
        0.07
